reinforcements.similarity: Both address the human-to-digital trust bridge. The existing element (works-004 from the library) prescribes agent name/photo on the platform to bridge human trust to digital trust. The new element (works-001) extends this by prescribing that the MATCH be shown before the platform — leading with specific guests, not platform features.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence (andreas-call.txt): Bryant's name must appear on the platform to bridge trust. New evidence (dimitri-call.txt): Dimitri engaged because of specific guests (Ariel/Amber), not the platform. Combined: the trust bridge needs BOTH agent identity AND specific demand-side content.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address the speed imperative. The existing works-003 prescribes matching platform cognitive speed to phone call conversational speed. The new works-003 addresses time-bounded atomic network formation — the urgency of completing the first deal before the host defaults to alternatives.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: Andreas conveyed property info in 7 seconds; the platform must match. New: Dimitri gave a 1-week deadline. Both demand speed, but at different scales: micro-interaction speed (library) and deal-completion speed (new).

reinforcements.similarity: Both address status communication for absent hosts. The existing library element (from the Dana run) prescribes between-stay status displays. The new element extends this to weekly push digests for hosts who are overseas for months, not just between weekly stays.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: Dana needs between-stay reassurance (Friday-Sunday). New: Dimitri needs between-continent reassurance (July-September). Same principle, dramatically different scale. Combined: status architecture must scale from 3-day gaps to 90-day gaps.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address respectful pacing with skeptical hosts. The existing feels-003 (patient follow-up email from Dana run) prescribes 'no rush' language. The new feels-001 extends this to a broader principle: treat third-party distrust as reasonable, not resistant.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: Patient follow-up email with 'absolutely no rush.' New: Dimitri's 'I don't deal with third parties' demands more than patience — it demands respect for his skepticism and evidence-based trust-building.

contradictions.conflict: The library's works-002 (Design for the Depleted User) assumes multi-step processes with decompression moments between phases. The new works-001 (Atomic Network Assembly) prescribes a single-session deal completion flow. These could conflict if the single-session flow creates depletion without the prescribed decompression moments.
contradictions.evidence_comparison: Both have strong evidence. The depletion principle (Kahneman) is universal. The single-session urgency (Dimitri + Cold Start) is specific to agent-recruited hosts. Resolution: the single-session flow MUST include micro-decompression moments (progress confirmations, 'looks good' checkpoints) within its compressed timeline.
contradictions.recommendation: Apply both: single-session flow with inline decompression moments. The flow is fast but includes breathing room at each step transition.

extensions.gap_filled: Dual verification transparency — the library has verification badges (ds-ui-0800-002, Property Protection Shield) but no pattern for showing platform verification alongside host-accessible personal documents. This is new territory.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens, but evidence is strong (Dimitri's explicit demand for driver's license access). Likely to be reinforced by other verification-demanding hosts.

extensions.gap_filled: Remote overseas host monitoring — existing elements cover between-stay gaps (3-day) but not between-continent gaps (90-day overseas absence). This is a new user archetype: the seasonal overseas host.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens, but the archetype is significant (hosts traveling for work to Europe). Will be strengthened if other hosts express similar overseas monitoring needs.

extensions.gap_filled: Magic link onboarding — no existing element prescribes account-free match presentation via magic link. This is a new interaction pattern for agent-recruited hosts.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. The pattern is common in consumer products (magic link auth) but novel for Split Lease. Should be validated with usability testing.

extensions.gap_filled: Cross-timezone video tour scheduling — no existing element addresses scheduling interactions across timezones. This fills the calendar/scheduling gap identified in the library.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. Moderate confidence — Dimitri specifically offered video tours, and timezone scheduling is a common marketplace need.

extensions.gap_filled: Platform vocabulary translation — no existing element addresses the language gap between traditional sublease vocabulary and platform terminology. This is an information architecture extension.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens, but the pattern (vocabulary mismatch causing confusion) is likely universal among experienced hosts who have pre-existing sublease mental models.

new_tokens_flagged: --surface-personal (looks-001): warm off-white tint for agent-mediated content
--status-ok-bg (looks-003): subtle green-purple tint for 'all clear' status cards
--status-attention-bg (looks-003): warm amber tint for 'needs attention' cards
token_compliance.recommendation: Add --surface-personal as a variant of existing --bg-off-white (rgb(252, 250, 255)) — this already exists in the style guide. The status tints (--status-ok-bg and --status-attention-bg) should be derived from existing palette: --status-ok-bg could use a lighter variant of --protocol-surface (#F7F2FA) and --status-attention-bg should map to an amber variant. Flag for design team review.

arc_conflicts: Safety appears in 4 of 8 phases, which risks creating a paranoid rather than trusting arc. But for a skeptical host like Dimitri, safety IS trust. The arc is appropriate for this host archetype.
emotional_arc_check.arc_assessment: The emotional arc progresses from safety (discovery/evaluation) through momentum (onboarding/listing) to calm (active lease/retention). This maps correctly to Dimitri's journey: he starts skeptical, moves fast once convinced, and needs reassurance while overseas. The arc is healthy.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: Looks layer should develop specific visual patterns for magic link pages vs. logged-in pages. Currently no distinction.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: behaves-001 defines magic link interaction flow. Looks layer should specify how pre-auth pages differ visually from post-auth pages while maintaining brand consistency.
